text: Amy will visit the man she worked with last month, but she is nervous about it.
question: Is Amy nervous?

text: Paul will marry the woman he just met last month, but the wedding will be small.
question: Will Paul have a small wedding?

text: Dan wrote the speech he will deliver next month, but he hasn't practiced it yet.
question: Has Dan practiced the speech?

text: Jeff planned the party he will hold next month, but he hasn't sent invitations.
question: Has Jeff sent invitations?

text: The crowd cheered for the model, and the designer took a bow after the show.
question: Did the designer take a bow?

text: The juggler entertained the children, and their parents drank wine at the party.
question: Did the juggler drink wine?

text: The woman dressed her baby, and her son got his clothes from the dresser.
question: Did the women dress her son?

text: Diane hugged her boyfriend, and her friend felt uncomfortable watching them.
question: Did Diane's friend feel uncomfortable?

text: The sister of the prince who injured himself falling off a roof was still sad.
question: Was the prince sad?

text: The daughter of the actor who hated himself for failing always seemed unhappy.
question: Was the daughter of the actor happy?

text: The sister of the salesman who made a fool of himself at work was very angry.
question: Was the sister of the salesman angry?

text: Mike watered the flower he will sell tomorrow, but he forgot to water the bush.
question: Did Mike forget to water the flowers?

text: Mary called the applicant she will interview tomorrow, but there was no answer.
question: Did the applicant answer?

text: James will fix the car he drove yesterday, but he will need some help.
question: Did James drive a car?

text: Linda will wear the sweater she washed yesterday, but she won't wear her skirt.
question: Will Linda wear her skirt?

text: Lisa will change the plans she made next week, but she won't cancel any of them.
question: Will Lisa change her plans?

text: Joseph brewed the beer he will serve last week, but it is not very tasty.
question: Will Joseph serve the beer?

text: Jane prepared the lecture she will give last week, but still needs to review it.
question: Did Jane review the lecture?

text: Sue insulted the candidate she will debate yesterday, but she wishes she hadn't.
question: Did Sue insult the candidate?

text: Robert will meet the friend he phoned tomorrow, but he doesn't want to.
question: Does Robert want to meet his friend?

text: Anne will serve the apples she picked tomorrow, but she won't serve the plums.
question: Will Anne serve the plums?

text: The woman could not find Bill, and his girlfriend became nervous and upset.
question: Could the woman find Bill?

text: Bobby yelled at the teacher, and the principal asked his parents for a meeting.
question: Did Bobby yell at the teacher?

text: The teacher praised the girl, and her family was proud of her good grades.
question: Was the girl's family proud of her grades?

text: The producer replaced the actor and the actress quit the movie after the fight.
question: Did the producer replace the actor?

text: Jim listened to the pianist and the singer watched the organist at the concert.
question: Did the singer listen to the pianist?

text: The ranger gave matches to the camper and his friend made a fire by the tent.
question: Did the camper make a fire?

text: The little girl fed her pet cat and her dog wanted a can of food, too.
question: Did the little girl feed her dog?

text: The tourist photographed the swimmer and the runner got ready for the race.
question: Did the tourist photograph the runner?

text: The swimmer disappointed her coach and her mother tried to console her.
question: Did the swimmer's mother try to console her?

text: The nurse examined the mother and the child played quietly in the corner.
question: Did the child play quietly?

text: The grandfather of the policewoman who treated herself so badly was troubled.
question: Was the grandfather of the policewoman troubled?

text: The nephew of the maid who cut herself with the knife called the doctor.
question: Did the nephew of the maid call the doctor?

text: The brother of the ballerina who found herself in a lot of trouble phoned home.
question: Did the ballerina phone home?

text: The son of the princess who scratched herself in public was awfully embarrassed.
question: Was the princess embarrassed?

text: The aunt of the schoolboy who hurt herself was concerned about the injury.
question: Was the schoolboy concerned about the injury?

text: The grandma of the fireman who criticized herself far too often was anxious.
question: Was the fireman anxious?

text: The grandfather of the woman who killed himself last summer had been to prison.
question: Had the grandfather of the woman been to prison?

text: The brother of the schoolgirl who burned himself was usually very careful.
question: Was the brother of the schoolgirl usually careful?

text: The son of the lady who politely introduced himself was popular at the party.
question: Was the lady popular at the party?

text: The uncle of the waitress who hurt himself was shocked by the accident.
question: Was the waitress shocked by the accident?

text: The brother of the bride who embarrassed himself at the wedding felt ashamed.
question: Was the brother of the bride ashamed?

text: Tom will plant the tree he bought next week, but he isn't sure where to put it.
question: Does Tom know where to put the tree?

text: The son of the actress who shot himself on the set was under investigation.
question: Was the son of the actress under investigation?

text: David caught the fish he will cook yesterday, but it is not his favorite kind.
question: Will David cook the fish?

text: The audience applauded the guitarist and the band cheered for him very loudly.
question: Did the audience applaud the guitarist?

text: The customer complained about the waiter, and the chef gave him a free dessert.
question: Did the customer get a free dessert?

text: The daughter of the man who complimented himself in public was beautiful.
question: Was the daughter of the man beautiful?

text: The father of the pretty girl cleaned up the house all by himself last week.
question: Did the pretty girl clean the house?

text: Bill will quit his job next month to take care of his kids and step-children.
question: Will Bill quit his job?

text: The thief noticed the boy and the girl watching him from the upstairs window.
question: Did the boy watch the thief?

text: The boy who was wearing a blue cap went missing on his way home last week.
question: Was the boy wearing a blue cap?

text: Hugh took too long to propose, and his girlfriend decided to marry someone else.
question: Did Hughs girlfriend propose to him?

text: The old man amused himself by gossiping with his children and friends.
question: Did the old man gossip with his friends?

text: Jane and John studied math and history yesterday, but they failed the exams.
question: Did Jane and John pass the exams?

text: The infant was able to stand by himself for the first time last week.
question: Did the infant stand by himself last week?
